query: We've detected a suspicious IP address, 8.8.8.8, in our server logs. I need a full threat report on it. Check its reputation for spam and botnets using NetDetective, look up its ASN details to see who owns the network, and also see if it appears on any real-time malicious indicator feeds from TweetFeed.

tool list.tool description: Queries an IP address to retrieve details such as whether it is associated with spam, brute-force attacks, bot-nets, VPN endpoints, or data center endpoints. This is part of NetDetective, an easy-to-use API that provides comprehensive threat intelligence to help quickly gather information about any IP address, enabling users to filter requests and avoid potential attacks.

Looks up AS Numbers, returning type, organisation details, routes, and other related data. This uses AI-powered modules from the parent tool's framework, designed to prevent payment fraud by analyzing network infrastructure data and identifying suspicious patterns through detailed ASN analysis.

Retrieves malicious URLs, domains, IPs, and hashes from the free feed. This endpoint leverages automated collection and analysis to provide real-time threat intelligence, aggregating data from multiple sources to offer a comprehensive view of emerging threats. The service, accessible at [tweetfeed.live](https://tweetfeed.live), helps security professionals quickly identify and mitigate potential risks by delivering up-to-date IOCs.

query_simple_gemini-2.5-pro: Find the malicious IPs from the TweetFeed for the last week, and then for each IP, use NetDetective to check if it's associated with a bot-net.
query_hard_gemini-2.5-pro: I'm looking into a potential security incident. Could you start by examining the IP address 8.8.8.8 to see if it's linked to any unusual activities like spam or botnets? I'd also like to know which organization is responsible for that network. As a final step, can you pull a list of all malicious IP addresses that have been reported over the last week?
query_simple_claude_v37: First queried the IP address 8.8.8.8 using NetDetective to check if it's associated with malicious activities like spam, brute-force attacks, or bot-nets. Then performed an ASN lookup on AS15169 using Greip with API key 2517bc4fc3f790e8f09bc808bb63b899 to retrieve organization details, routes, and network infrastructure data. Finally, retrieved malicious IP addresses reported in the past week from TweetFeed's threat intelligence feed.
query_hard_claude_v37: I need to check if Google's DNS server (8.8.8.8) has any security issues. Could you also look up information about Google's autonomous system number (15169) and see if this IP has been reported in any malicious activity feeds in the past week?

query: I need to run a security audit on my website, 'https://example-vulnerable-site.com'. Please perform a full web reconnaissance scan to find all subdomains and associated IP addresses. For the main domain, run a port scan to see what services are exposed, and finally, scan all the JavaScript files for known vulnerabilities.

tool list.tool description: Initiates a web scan of a target URL, generating a scan ID to retrieve results or check status later. This endpoint leverages the parent tool's capability to collect subdomains, IP addresses, web technologies, and emails through automated scanning, providing comprehensive data for security assessments or reconnaissance tasks. Users can optionally provide a callback URL to receive scan results automatically via POST once the scan completes.

Checks the status of a web scan (ongoing/completed) using a scan ID. This endpoint is part of a service that scans the web for subdomains, IP addresses, web technologies, and emails, enabling users to track scan progress and access detailed results efficiently. By leveraging automated web crawling and data aggregation, the tool provides real-time insights into the collected information, ensuring users can monitor their scans and retrieve critical data seamlessly.

Obtains scan results by querying a specific scan ID. This endpoint leverages the web scanning tool's capability to analyze subdomains, IP addresses, web technologies, and emails, delivering structured data from comprehensive scans to provide actionable insights into a target's digital footprint.

Scans ports for a given IP address and port range using the Portscanner Online API Version 1.0.0, a cutting-edge solution that delivers modern, accessible APIs for secure and efficient online port scans. This tool leverages contemporary technology standards to empower developers and businesses with reliable port scanning capabilities, ensuring seamless integration and enhanced interoperability.

Scans a target IP for open ports. This uses modern technology standards and secure data exchange to empower developers and businesses to conduct online port scans with confidence, ensuring efficient and reliable network security assessments.

Scans a website's JavaScript files for vulnerabilities by sending POST data with a URL parameter. This uses automated vulnerability detection to analyze scripts against known security flaws, providing actionable insights to strengthen web application security.

query_simple_gemini-2.5-pro: Find all IP addresses for example-vulnerable-site.com and then perform a simple port scan on each discovered IP.
query_hard_gemini-2.5-pro: I need a full security workup on example-vulnerable-site.com. Please start by gathering all the details about its web presence and infrastructure. Once you have that, perform a simple scan to see what network ports are open. Finally, analyze the website's javascript for any security holes.
query_simple_claude_v37: Perform a comprehensive security assessment of example-vulnerable-site.com by first initiating a web scan using WebLasso to gather subdomains, IP addresses, web technologies, and emails. Once the scan is initiated, check its status until completion, then retrieve the detailed scan results. Next, conduct a port scan on the same target to identify open ports and potential network vulnerabilities using the Port Scanner API. Finally, analyze the website's JavaScript files for security vulnerabilities using the JavaScript Vulnerability Scan tool to detect potential code-level weaknesses.
query_hard_claude_v37: Can you perform a comprehensive security assessment of example-vulnerable-site.com? I need to know what subdomains exist, what IP addresses are associated with it, what technologies they're using, and if there are any open ports or JavaScript vulnerabilities that could be exploited.

query: We just received a suspicious online order. Please analyze the following data points for fraud risk: The customer's IP address is '104.18.32.201', their email is 'test@example.com', their phone number is '1-800-555-1234', and their card's BIN is '453999'. I need a risk assessment based on these inputs.

tool list.tool description: Returns geolocation data for a given IP address. This endpoint is part of AI-powered modules designed to prevent payment fraud, leveraging geolocation insights to detect suspicious activities and enhance security by identifying potential threats in real-time.

Validates email addresses as an additional layer of security. This uses AI-powered modules from the payment fraud prevention system to verify email legitimacy, enhancing overall transaction security by reducing fraudulent activities.

Validates phone numbers to enhance payment fraud prevention by leveraging AI-powered modules that analyze number legitimacy in real-time, integrating seamlessly into existing systems to strengthen security protocols.

Validates a BIN/IIN number to retrieve details such as the bank, brand, type, scheme, and country. This is part of the AI-Powered modules designed to prevent payment fraud by analyzing transaction data and verifying the legitimacy of card information, enhancing security through real-time validation and fraud detection capabilities.

query_simple_gemini-2.5-pro: With the API key 2517bc4fc3f790e8f09bc808bb63b899, perform a lookup for the BIN 453999 to find its bank, brand, and country details.
query_hard_gemini-2.5-pro: I need to run a full security check on a suspicious transaction. Please verify the following details: the user's IP is 104.18.32.201, their email is test@example.com, their US-based phone number is 8005551234, and the first six digits of their payment card are 453999.
query_simple_claude_v37: Analyze a transaction by performing multiple security checks: lookup geolocation data for IP address 104.18.32.201, validate the email address test@example.com, verify US phone number 8005551234, and perform a BIN lookup for card number starting with 453999 to detect potential payment fraud
query_hard_claude_v37: I need to verify some information for a suspicious transaction. Can you check the location of IP address 104.18.32.201, validate if test@example.com is a legitimate email, verify if 8005551234 is a valid US phone number, and look up details for credit card BIN 453999?

query: I'm looking at a new cryptocurrency token with the contract address '0x123...abc' on the Ethereum network. Can you please run a scan on this token? I need to know if it's a potential honeypot, what its buy and sell taxes are, and if there are any other suspicious functions hidden in its contract.

tool list.tool name: Token Scanner Multichain | Honeypot Checker Multichain: Scan Token
tool list.tool description: Scans a token address to detect honeypots, analyze buy/sell taxes, suspicious functions, liquidity, and ownership details. This endpoint leverages a multichain blockchain analysis framework to provide comprehensive token insights, enabling users to evaluate risks and characteristics across decentralized networks by examining critical metrics from multiple blockchain ecosystems.

query_simple_gemini-2.5-pro: Check if the token with address 0x123...abc on the ethereum chain is a honeypot and analyze its buy/sell taxes.
query_hard_gemini-2.5-pro: Hey, I came across this new coin on the Ethereum network, 0x123...abc. Before I put any money into it, could you tell me if there are any red flags or if it looks like a scam?
query_simple_claude_v37: Can you scan this Ethereum token address 0x123...abc for me to check if it's a honeypot? I want to know about its buy/sell taxes, any suspicious functions in the contract, liquidity details, and ownership information before I invest in it.
query_hard_claude_v37: Can you check if this Ethereum token 0x123...abc is a honeypot? I want to know about its taxes, liquidity and if there are any suspicious functions before I invest.

query: I need to set up a new vulnerability scan in our security testing environment. Please add the host at IP address '192.168.1.100' as a new target in our PENTESTON framework. Once it's added, please initiate a full system scan against it.

tool list.tool description: Adds a new host target to a cybersecurity assessment framework, requiring parameters such as IP address, domain, and vulnerability scores. This endpoint leverages PENTESTON's API Requests, which provide tools for enhancing security postures by checking systems, networks, and applications. It utilizes a database of known vulnerabilities to prioritize targets, enabling security professionals to streamline penetration testing and improve threat detection accuracy.

Scans a system for vulnerabilities using predefined security protocols. This leverages the PENTESTON API's capabilities, which are designed to enhance security postures by checking computer systems, networks, and applications. The endpoint utilizes AI-driven analysis and integrates with cybersecurity tools to identify potential risks, enabling developers and security professionals to proactively address weaknesses in their infrastructure.

query_simple_gemini-2.5-pro: Please add a new target host at 192.168.1.100 with the name 'Target 192.168.1.100', and then initiate a 'Full System Scan for 192.168.1.100' on it using the nmaps, nikto, dnsrc, dnscn, dirb0, rusts, mstcp, cmsmp, and jooms tools.
query_hard_gemini-2.5-pro: I need to set up a new security assessment. First, please add a new target named 'Target 192.168.1.100' for the IP address 192.168.1.100. Once it's added, please launch a scan on it. For the scan, label the test 'Full System Scan for 192.168.1.100' and ensure you use the following tools: nmaps, nikto, dnsrc, dnscn, dirb0, rusts, mstcp, cmsmp, and jooms.
query_simple_claude_v37: Add a new target with IP address 192.168.1.100 to the PENTESTON cybersecurity assessment framework, then initiate a comprehensive vulnerability scan on this target using multiple security tools including nmap, nikto, DNS reconnaissance, directory brute forcing, and CMS mapping tools.
query_hard_claude_v37: I need to run a comprehensive security scan on my server at 192.168.1.100. Could you add this as a target in the system and then perform a full vulnerability assessment using all the standard scanning tools?
